VLC Is Completely Free, and regularly updated btw.

DTS is da bomb?
Oh please...

If an AC3 or AAC track is encoded with the same volume level as a (usually louder) DTS track, then you can't hear the difference. The main reason people think the DTS track sounds better is that its volume level is higher than other track types, and all you need to do is turn up your volume knob to make an AC3 track sound the same.

Also, the DTS codec is not as good at compression as AC3 or AAC, which is why the DTS tracks are so much larger. Please save the space, use AC3 instead of DTS.

http://www.hifi-writer.com/he/dolbydts/dolbydts.htm

Also, AAC is a very good codec. If my home theater supported AAC 5.1 then I would be happy to use this format for all my content, as it uses VBR encoding, unlike AC3 or DTS which both use CBR encoding, which wastes space and bitrate on the parts that don't need it. AAC is not just for "non-home cinema applications". Its a next gen codec designed for top quality sound, as well as low bitrate applications, which gives it great flexibility.

V-10, A-8, M-7 Thanx
